results.title: Staying upfront
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubetzki, Film Australia and Stephen Ramsey
results.brief_description: This is a film about a long distance owner truck driver and his family. The reasons why he became an owner-driver are explored as well as the rewards he gets from it, and the effect on his family of operating in a high pressure, often marginal income industry.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Rubetzki, Film Australia and Stephen Ramsey

results.title: Staying number one: The Swingers
results.creator_credit: John Cruthers, Ray Argall and Musical Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Pop Movie”.
Follows the quest for fame and fortune by the New Zealand rock group, “The Swingers”, in Australia starting with their hit ‘Counting the Beat’ and tracing them through their involvement with the feature film ‘Starstruck’, to their eventual break-up in mid 1982. Includes interviews with promoter Michael Gudinski, the group’s manager, and “The Swingers” themselves as well as several promotion clips.

results.title: Staying alive show (episodes 1, 2 & 3)
results.creator_credit: Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group, David Ferris, Lyndall Horton-Jones and Malcolm Orr
results.brief_description: An entertaining video which reinforces the traffic safety message for children in the early to middle primary years. Using the format of a popular TV game show, contestants are qizzed on the do’s and don’ts of pedestrian and passenger safety.

results.title: Status = Status anxiety
results.creator_credit: Neil Crombie, Channel Four Television Corporation and James Runcie
results.brief_description: Alain de Botton presents this three-part documentary series which is an exploration of the modern dilemma of how work and objects define a person’s status in western society. Are we cash rich but spiritually poor? Does wealth equate to happiness? Why do we worry so much about what people think of us? Alain de Botton has a interesting take on this resulting in thought provoking television through the use of contemporary interviews mixed with some views of ancient philosophers brought into the contemporary context. He also talks to people with an alternative view, such as naturists and bohemians, to find out their understanding of ‘status’. Another interesting series by the same presenter is “Philosophy: a guide to happiness” [318970]. Written by Alain de Botton.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Neil Crombie, Channel Four Television Corporation and James Runcie

results.title: Statistics and probabilty. No. 2 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Edward Goldwyn, BBC-TV, Open University and Robert Clamp
results.brief_description: Begins with a consideration of the concept of mathematical probability related to the external world by associating probabilities of sample points with relative frequency with which outcomes occur. D.V. Lindley, University College, London, speaks about subjective probability.

results.title: Stations of the elevated
results.brief_description: Beginning in the switching yards as they set out on their daily route, Kirchheimer has photographed New Yorks trains as works of art and canvases for the city’s graffiti. As they travel through the decaying urban landscape, they are juxtaposed with advertisements which the filmmaker calls ‘sanctioned vandalism’. Eloquently combines glimpses of faces, billboards and 20th Century artefacts with an urban jazz soundtrack, by Charles Mingus, to create a political film exploring the possibilities of cinema and the visual texture of urban life.

results.title: Stations
results.brief_description: A story, set in Brisbane in 1953, about a young woman who falls in love and becomes pregnant. What follows is a painful and deliberate account of women’s resilience in the face of the dilemmas and social constraints of Australia in the fifties. Stars Noni Hazelhurst and Tim Burns.

results.title: Stationary transverse waves
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “College Physics”.
Animated drawings are used in explaining the nature of stationary waves. Includes demonstrations of pulse reflection at the fixed end of a stretched string, the reflection of a steady wave train at the string boundary, and compounding of oppositely travelling wave trains. Identifies nodes and anti-nodes, and shows the resonance patterns for a stretched string of limited length.
